meta.article_title: April 17, 2017 - Serving to the Backhand Flipper

terminologie_extrait.definition: Spin on a serve that causes the ball to drop rapidly after contact with the racket.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: Used in serves and attacking plays.

serving_to_the_backhand_flipper.probleme: Opponent attacks all serves with backhand, even short ones
causes_communes: Player reaches over and backhands even forehand flips

debutant.description: Serve with the ball barely above the net, with a nice low bounce on the far side.
Throw deep serves at the opponent, few players are good at attacking both short and long serves.

intermediaire.description: Load up the backspin, many opponents will struggle to attack it.

exercices_complementaires.description: Mix up the spin, from backspin to no-spin serves.
Serve with angle into the forehand, giving you an angle into the opponent's forehand.
